loans.name: Dhan Kumari

texts.en:
Dhan Kumari is 41 years old. She is married and has two children aged 18 and 14.  In 2004, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Dhan Kumari plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 
In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Nura

texts.en:
Nura is 38 years old. She is married and has two children aged 17 and 12.  In 2000, she established her tailoring business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Nura plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 
In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Gbedjromede Group

texts.fr: GBEDJROMEDE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Agbannago (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 64 ans. Agbannago n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Agbannago est mariée à un cultivateur nommé Déhonou. Le couple a un enfant, non scolarisé. Agbannago vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Les charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Agbannago achète des noix de palme, qu'elle transforme en huile végétale, qu'elle vend dans sa région depuis vingt cinq ans. Agbannago vend aussi du vin de palme. Agbannago s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Agbannago s’associe aux autres membres du groupe GBEDJROMEDE pour solliciter un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Gbedjromede is a group of 3 people who are friends and live in the same district. The group's leader, Agbannago (the one with her hand raised in the picture), is 64 years old. Agbannago did not go to school. Agbannago is married to a farmer called Déhonou. The couple have one child who does not attend school. Agbannago lives together with her husband and child. The couple both cover the household expenses. In order to be able to meet her family's needs, Agbannago has been buying coconuts, producing palm oil and reselling it in her area for 25 years. Agbannago also sells palm wine. Agbannago gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In order to strengthen her business, Agbannago has joined with the other members of the Gbedjromede group in requesting a 5th loan from ALIDé. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and palm wine.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is married and she lives in a rented house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills. She operates a beauty salon business. She operates from home whereby neighbours and passersby are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to accommodate more customers in the future.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase a hairdrying machine for her business. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a hairdrying machine for her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a hard-working thirty-four-year old coffee trader in a local cell in Kashekuro parish and he has had a coffee business since 2006, working six days a week. The objective of starting the business was to earn profits and be financially stable. In addition to selling coffee, John has a motorcycle which he uses to transport people at a fair fee which supplements his income. John’s children are in school and his future plan is to give the children a better quality education which he can only do if he earns enough from the business. He is asking for a loan of one million shillings so that he can buy and stock more coffee beans which in the long run will bring him profits.

loans.use: To buy coffee beans

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is a farmer in Rugabagaba Mushunga in Mittoma District and is also a coffee trader in the same area. Though he trades coffee, his major source of income is from farming which he has done since 1996 and has no regrets about having started the business. He is a father of six children who are all in school and this gives him a challenge to work harder since he has to get enough money to pay their school fees which he does not do easily since the profits from the business are minimal. His clients are coffee traders in the same area and he plans to use the loan money of one million shillings to buy coffee seeds and mulch for the coffee plantation with much hope that this will help him get higher profits. Despite the challenge of competition which he is faced with, Frank is confident that one day he will be financially stable and will be able to pay school fees for his children with ease.

loans.use: To buy coffee seeds and mulch

loans.name: Haydee Narcisa

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Dinámicas y Talentosas se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio San Pedro en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Haydee, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  17 años de edad el cual estudia en colegio. Su esposo realiza trabajos de limpieza.
Doña Haydee es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta a base de esfuerzo y trabajo ganarse algo por su cuenta con lo cual poder ayudar a su hijo en sus gastos de los estudios, ella hace esto ya que su marido no gana mucho y con lo que él hace solo alcanza para los alimentos es por eso que ella hace ya 12 años empezó a vender zapatos, toallas, sabanas, bisuterías entre otras cosas.  Sale a recorrer por la localidad donde ya tiene muy buena clientela, ella aprovechó el primer crédito que recibió de la institución para empezar con su negocio por lo cual está muy agradecida por la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos, toallas y sabanas. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y los créditos. Ella sueña tener un buen local y así mejorar más su vida.
texts.en:
The Crédito Dinámicas y Talentosas [Dynamic and Talented Credit] Group meets twice a month in the San Pedro section of the city of Manta, which is renowned for its unparalleled beauty, many tourist sites, and the lovely beaches that are crowded with visitors all year.  

Manta is the home of Doña Haydee, age 38, married, and the mother of a 17-year-old son who attends high school. Señora Haydee's husband works as a cleaner. 

Doña Haydee is a very determined woman who enjoys the opportunity to work hard and earn money that helps her son cover the cost of his education. Doña Haydee works hard as her husband doesn't earn much and his wages only pay for the family's food. Doña Haydee has therefore sold shoes, towels, linens, costume jewelry, and other goods  for 12 years. She goes around her neighborhood to sell these items, and has a strong customer base. Doña Haydee used her first loan from the institution to start her business, and is therefore very grateful for the opportunity to improve her quality of life. 

This loan is for the purchase of shoes, towels, and linens. Doña Haydee has a been a member of the Dynamic and Talented Credit Group since it began and is happy with the group's support and the loans it provides. She aspires to set up a good shop and thus improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, towels, and linens.

loans.name: Carmita Dolores

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amigas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmita, tiene 57años de edad, es madre soltera de 4  hijos mayores de edad, con ella vive un nieto que tiene 8 años que es como su hijo ya que ella es la que le da todo al pequeño. 
Doña Carmita con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante sola  se dedica a la cría de chanchos y gallinas criollas, tiene un corral donde les alimenta sus animalitos, los chanchos los compra pequeños y los mantiene por un tiempo y cuando están listos los vende a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa, ellos los llevan a otras ciudades para faenarlos y vender su carne, de la misma forma hace con las gallinas las cuales las vende a muy buen precio ya que son muy solicitadas por su rico sabor.
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los chanchos y las gallinas. Lleva 6 años  en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le ayudan a salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y darle lo mejor a su nieto.
texts.en:
The Amigas de Tosagua communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua, a place known for being dynamic, where most of the residents are farmers and raise animals.  It’s an area of great vegetation. 

Carmita lives here.  She is 57 years old and the single mother of 4 adult children.  Her eight year old grandson lives with her and he is like a son to her; she provides everything for him.

Carmia raises pigs and chickens so she can earn some money on her own and get ahead.  She has a pen where she feeds her animals.  She buys piglets, keeps then for some time, and then sells them to merchants when they are ready.  They take them to other cities to slaughter and sell the meat.  She does the same for the chickens and sells them at very good prices because they are very sought after for their good flavor.

She will use the money from this loan to buy feed and medicine for the pigs and chickens.  She has been with the credit group for six years and she likes it because the loans always help her to get ahead.  Her dreams are to be in good health and to give the best to her grandson.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her animals.

loans.name: Omar Albeiro

texts.es: Omar, a sus 27 años de edad, es casado y padre de tres pequeños hijos, a los cuales ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Trabaja atendiendo su propio taller de pintura, actividad que realiza desde hace aproximadamente 8 años y que conoció gracias a las enseñanzas de un familiar; cuenta con la ventaja de no poseer competencia cercana, por lo que puede atender todo tipo de requerimientos, pero esta lejanía también representa la única desventaja y es que queda alejado de su casa, por lo que se le dificulta el transporte diariamente; sin embargo, ha sabido llevar la situación y ha salido adelante. Actualmente se interesa en pedir el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de una máquina polichadora e insumos al por mayor (pinturas y lacas), de esta manera podrá agilizar su proceso de producción y tendrá disponibilidad de insumos para cumplir con los diferentes gustos y requerimientos de sus clientes, lo que le permitirá mejorar las ventas y los ingresos que recibe por ellas. Omar manifiesta que su principal meta es continuar con su negocio pero en un lugar más cercano a su hogar, así podrá estar pendiente de su familia y ahorrar dinero, pues no gastaría tanto en su transporte diario, dando como resultado una mejor rentabilidad y estabilidad económica, para así brindar mejor bienestar y condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Omar is 27 years old, married and father of three small children. He has supported them through a lot of effort and dedication.

He works tending to his own paint shop, an activity that he has been doing for approximately 8 years and that he learned thanks to the lessons from a relative.

He has the advantage of having no nearby competition so he can meet all types of demands, but this distance also offers the only disadvantage in that being away from his house it presents the difficulty of daily transportation, however, he has carried on moved forward.

At this time he is interested in asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of a polisher and supplies at wholesale prices (paints and lacquers) in order to streamline his production process and to have stock on hand in order to fulfill the various tastes and requests of his customers. This will allow him to increase sales and profits he receives from them.

Omar says that his main goal is to continue with his business but in a location nearer his home, so he can watch over his family and save money, not spending so much on daily transportation, which would result in better profits and financial stability and providing better welfare and living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a polisher and supplies at wholesale prices (paints and lacquers)

loans.name: Joyeuse Group

texts.fr: La cliente Angélique est une conseillère de l’association d’affaire  «Joyeuse», senior entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 60 ans, veuve et mère de 2 enfants qui sont tous mariés. La cliente est  une vendeuse de pagnes. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché public  et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance  de son mari (alors de son vivant). Il y a 31 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 8 pièces de pagnes (super wax). Ainsi, elle souhaite  étendre son projet de commerce et construire une maison pour ses petits fils. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Angélique, the customer, is an advisor to the business group Joyeuse. A senior, experienced and dynamic entrepreneur, she is 60 years old, a widow and the mother of 2 children who are both married. Angélique sells pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth). She displays her merchandise at the public market and sometimes at her home. She started her business with the help of her husband, when he was alive, and has been in this line of work for 31 years. This new loan will be used to buy 8 pieces of pagnes (super wax variety). She would like to expand her business and build a house for her grandchildren. Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for helping non-bankable women entrepreneurs to become self-sufficient, especially in this critical time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 8 pieces of pagnes (super wax variety).

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rafiki Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sekalyango est une conseillère de l’association  d’affaire «Rafiki», senior  entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 53 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui sont tous étudiants. Son conjoint est un chômeur, toute fois, il réalise de petites commissions sur la vente de parcelle. La cliente est une vendeuse de plastiques. Elle installe ses marchandises au long de la rue et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari Il y a 25 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter les plastics (bassins, gobelets, plats, etc.). Ainsi, elle souhaite  étendre son projet de commerce et construire une maison pour ses enfants.  Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Sekalyango, the customer, is an advisor to the Rafiki business group. A senior, experienced and dynamic entrepreneur, she is 53 years old and the mother of 6 children who are all students. Her spouse is unemployed, although he does make some small commissions on the sales of land plots. Sekalyango sells plastic items. She displays her merchandise along the side of the road and sometimes at home. She started her business with the help of her husband and has been in this line of work for 25 years. This new loan will be used to buy plastic items (basins, tumblers, plates, etc.) She would like to expand her business and build a house for her children. Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for helping non-bankable women entrepreneurs to become self-sufficient, especially in this critical time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy plastic items (basins, tumblers, plates, etc.)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Amina Group

texts.fr: La cliente Esther est une conseillère  du groupe  d’affaire  «Amina», jeune  entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 34 ans, célibataire  et mère d’un enfant qui fait l’école maternelle. La cliente est  une vendeuse de pommes de terre.  Elle installe ses marchandises au marché public  et parfois à son domicile.  Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance  de son petit ami.  Il y a 3  ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 4 sacs de pommes de terre.  Ainsi, elle souhaite  étendre son projet de commerce et acheter une parcelle pour son  enfant.  Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Esther, age 34, is an advisor to the business group Amina. She is a young but dynamic and experienced entrepreneur, and the single mother of a child who attends kindergarten. She sells potatoes at the public market, sometimes from her home. She started her business with the help of her boyfriend and has been conducting this activity for three years. She will use this new loan to buy four sacks of potatoes. Her goals are to expand her activity and buy some land for her child.  

Esther wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping businesswomen to become self-sufficient who cannot use the traditional banking system, especially in these critical times of war in the Eastern region.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of potatoes for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, está compuesto por mujeres muy trabajadoras, que quieren ayudar a sus familias por medio del esfuerzo de todas. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de todas y conforme a eso trabajar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Myrian, quien quiere emprender en la venta de cosméticos, ya que quiere luchar por su familia, para darle un ingreso mejor, y que así no les falte nada. Es una persona con muchas metas y sueños.
La Sra. solicita de este crédito para la compra de venta de cosméticos, lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso consists of determined, hardworking women who want to work together to help their families. The members are participating in the Poverty Elimination Survey, which determines each member's situation and uses the results to guide members in their work. 

One member is Doña Myrian, who has many aspirations and goals. She wants to start selling cosmetics so that she can earn a better income and provide for all of her family's needs. 

Doña Myrian is applying fora  loan for the purchase of cosmetics for sale, which will allow her to formalize her plan for the business that will help her boost her income.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Flor Alba

texts.es: Flor, a sus 48 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y cabeza de hogar tras el fallecimiento de su esposo. Hace aproximadamente 20 años se dedica a la confección, actividad que aprendió de manera empírica y que le ha permitido salir adelante con su familia, cuenta con el apoyo de una empleada directa con la que trabaja todos los días de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm y, cuenta con la ventaja de tener ubicado su negocio en la casa donde vive, por lo que no debe gastar dinero en traslados; de esta manera ha generado los recursos económicos suficientes para dar educación y sustento a sus hijos. Es una mujer emprendedora, dinámica, alegre y carismática, a pesar de las adversidades siempre tiene una actitud positiva frente a la vida. Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el interés de invertirlo en la compra de materia prima al por mayor (hilos, telas, cierres, elásticos, entretela, entre otros) esto le permitirá tener material disponible para confeccionar su línea propia y le ayudará a mejorar su nivel de producción, generando mejores ingresos para su familia. Flor desea seguir luchando para llegar a cumplir el sueño de fortalecer y  hacer crecer su negocio, para que le permita generar oportunidades de empleo y, en un futuro poder montar un almacén para vender sus producciones; esto le ayudará a garantizar a sus hijos un futuro próspero y con una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Flor is 48 years old, mother of two children and is head of the household since the death of her husband.

She has been working in the sewing profession for approximately 20 years, an activity that she learned on her own and it has permitted her to support her family. She has the help of an employee who works every day from 9:00am until 7:00pm, and she has the advantage of having her business in the home where she lives, so she has no transportation costs, and so she has been able to have sufficient financial resources to give her children an education and to provide for them. She is an enterprising woman, dynamic, happy and charismatic, and despite adversities  she always has a positive attitude towards life.

She was motivated to ask for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of raw materials to buy at wholesale (thread, fabrics, zippers, elastic, interfacing, and more) that will allow her to have supplies on hand in order to make her own line and will help her improve her level of production, generating better income for the family.

Flor wants to continue fighting in order to reach her dream to strengthen and expand her business, so she can generate employment opportunities and in the future be able to open a store to sell her creations. This would help to guarantee her children future prosperity and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw material at wholesale prices (thread, fabric, zippers, elastic, interfacing, and more)

loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.fr: La cliente Masinda est une  présidente suppléante du groupe  d’affaire  «Nazareth», jeune  entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 32 ans  et mère de 2 enfants qui étudient tous.  Son conjoint est un commerçant de divers. La cliente est une vendeuse de pommes de terre.  Elle installe ses marchandises à son domicile.  Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance  de son mari. Il y a 2  ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 sacs de pommes de terre. Ainsi, elle souhaite  étendre son projet de commerce et acheter une parcelle pour sa famille.  Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Masinda, age 32, is a substitute president for the business group Nazareth. She is a young but dynamic and experienced entrepreneur, and the mother of two children who both go to school. Her spouse is a merchant of various goods. Masinda sells potatoes from her home. She started her business with the help of her husband, and she has been conducting this activity for two years. She will use this new loan to buy two sacks of potatoes. Her goals are to expand her activity and buy some land for her family.  

Masinda wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping businesswomen to become self-sufficient who cannot use the traditional banking system, especially in these critical times of war in the Eastern region.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of potatoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ndiaye Diop

texts.fr: Monsieur Ndiaye est un commerçant qui habite à som un quartier de la commune,  il s’active dans la commercialisation de pièces détachées. Il a sa cantine à cité Ousmane près de la seigneurie ; il demande ce montant pour renforcer son fond de roulement il a une expérience de plus de 7ans il est à son 2ème crédit il gère les charges quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A l’avenir il souhaite diversifier son activité afin de pouvoir augmenter  ses revenus et améliorer  les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Ndjaye is a retailer who lives in a district of a commune and sells spare parts. His small market store is in the city of Ousmane, near the seigneury. He is requesting this loan in order to strengthen his working capital. He has over 7 years experience in his line of work and is on his second loan. He covers the family's daily expenses and the children's education costs. In the future, he would like to diversify his business in order to increase his revenues and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Fulgencio

texts.es:
Fulgencio es una persona muy trabajadora, que con esfuerzo y lucha esta saliendo adelante, siempre trabaja duro en su despensa y mercería. Comenta que su anterior crédito de Kiva lo uso para poder comprar verduras, hortalizas, leche y otros, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Pide de este nuevo prestamo para poder comprar mas bebidas, comestibles, verduras, etc. y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando y trabajando.
texts.en: Fulgencio is a very hard working person, who with strength and struggle is moving forward. He always works hard in his store and pantry. He says that he used his previous Kiva loan to buy vegetables, milk, etc. which helped him very much. He requests this new loan to be able to buy more drinks, consumables, vegetables etc. and in this way to able to continue with his sales, struggling and working.

loans.use: to buy drinks, consumables, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es vendedor, y por medio de las ventas que hace, lucha para dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan, y que así no tengan que pasar por necesidades. Comenta que su anterior crédito lo uso para poder comprar artesanías para la venta, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide de un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de más artesanías, y así seguir luchando y creciendo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Antonio is a vendor, and with the sales that he makes, he fights to give his family all that they need so they don't have to go without necessities. He says that he used his previous loan to be able to buy handicrafts to sell, which helped him very much. Today he is requesting a new loan to invest in the purchase of more handicrafts to continue struggling and growing as before.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Julio Miguel

texts.es: Julio, a sus 53 años de edad,  se dedicó durante muchos años a las labores del campo, pues poseía cultivos y adicionalmente comercializaba cerdos, pero debido a una temporada fuerte de invierno, todos su cultivos se perdieron, obligándolo a desplazarse para otra ciudad, en busca de mejores opciones para salir adelante; e radicó con su esposa y sus 5 hijos y, con unos ahorros que poseía y un préstamo que obtuvo, inició su propio negocio; una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que le ha generado los recursos suficientes para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar durante los 3 años que lleva en el mercado. El cliente se caracteriza por ser pujante, perseverante y muy trabajador, a pesar de las adversidades, siempre sigue adelante, motivado por el amor a su familia. Solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (mecato, huevos, café, galletería, lácteos, cárnicos, entre otros) y una vitrina para exhibir sus productos, esto le permitirá tener más variedad de artículos disponibles para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada decembrina, lo que le genera mejores ingresos para seguir solventando los gastos y necesidades de su hogar. Julio desea seguir luchando arduamente para lograr cumplir el sueño de montar un minimercado bien surtido, en el que sus clientes puedan encontrar todos los productos que requieran, que le genere mejor rentabilidad y le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para dar mejor educación a sus hijos y les permita disfrutar de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Julio is 53 and for many years he worked in the country, growing crops and also selling pigs. However, because of a bad winter, he lost all his crops, which meant that he had to move to another city in order to look for better opportunities to get on in life. He moved with his wife and 5 children and, with some savings he had got together and a loan he took out, he started his own business: a small grocery shop that has generated enough income to meet the basic needs of the household during the 3 years he has been in the marketplace.

Julio is known for being energetic, persevering and very hard-working, in spite of adversity. He always forges ahead, motivated by love for his family. He is asking for this loan to invest in buying wholesale supplies such as snacks, eggs, coffee, biscuits, milk products and meat products, as well as a shop window to display his produce. This will allow him to have a bigger variety of goods available to satisfy the increased demand during December, which will generate a better income for him and allow him to continue meeting the costs and needs of the household.

Julio wants to continue fighting hard to achieve his dream of setting up a well-stocked mini-market, where his customers could find all the products they need. This would generate greater profits and guarantee him a favourable economic stability that would provide a better education for his children and let them enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies such as snacks, eggs, coffee, biscuits, milk products and meat products, as well as a shop window to display his produce.

loans.name: Cristian David

texts.es: Cristian es un joven emprendedor de 21 años de edad, víctima del desplazamiento forzado por la violencia que se presentó en su pueblo natal hace algunos años, razón por la que se radicó en otro pueblo, en busca de nuevas oportunidades laborales; debido a su inexperiencia y a su corta edad no pudo emplearse, por lo que decidió emprender su propio negocio, una venta de ropa de marcas muy reconocidas a nivel mundial, especialmente para caballeros; de esta forma ha logrado generar ingresos suficientes para apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar y para pagar sus estudios universitarios de mercadeo y ventas. Su espíritu de superación, su empuje, energía y dinamismo lo impulsan para buscar nuevas alternativas con las que pueda seguir avanzando, por ello, solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar mercancía al por mayor (jeans, camisas, perfumería, chaquetas, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada de navidad, en la que sus ventas se incrementan y le generan mejores ingresos económicos. Cristian es consciente que para darle continuidad a su negocio, debe trabajar con esfuerzo, dedicación y mucha disciplina, sólo así podrá llegar a cumplir su sueño de culminar sus estudios universitarios y aplicar todos sus conocimientos en la actividad que emprendió y que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos; con los que le brinda mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Cristian is a young businessman, only 21 years old, who was forced to flee the violence that erupted a few years ago in his hometown and move to another city to look for new job opportunities. Cristian's youth and lack of experience made him unemployable, so he decided to start his own business selling clothes made by well-known international designers, with a focus on men's fashion. Starting this business allowed Cristian to earn enough income to help his family pay household expenses and cover the cost of his university studies in sales and commerce. 

Cristian's ambition, energy, and dynamism compel him to seek new ways to get ahead. He's therefore applying for a loan so that he can purchase wholesale items (jeans, shirts, colognes, jackets, and other merchandise) to meet increased customer demand during the holiday season, when sales and income increase. Cristian is aware that in order to sustain his business, he has to keep working diligently, with dedication and great discipline. He knows that this is the only way to fulfill his aspiration to earn a university degree. As a college graduate, Cristian will be able to apply all of his experience to the  clothing business that he started. Clothing sales are now the main source of the income that will allow Cristian to provide his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale items (jeans, shirts, colognes, jackets, and other merchandise).

loans.name: La Paix Virunga Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kamwite est une secrétaire du groupe d’affaire  «La paix Virunga» entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 52 ans  et mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un commerçant de divers. La cliente est une vendeuse des épices. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché public et parfois à son domicile.  Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance  de son mari. Il y a 24 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter les 40 kg des épices. Ainsi, elle souhaite  étendre son projet de commerce et scolariser ses enfants. La pourriture de ses épices est un défi pour l’avancement de son commerce. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Kamwite, age 52, is a secretary for the business group La Paix Virunga. She is a dynamic and experienced entrepreneur, and the mother of eight children who all go to school. Her spouse is a merchant of various goods. Kamwite sells spices at the public market, and sometimes from her home. She started her business with the help of her husband, and she has been conducting this activity for 24 years. She will use this new loan to buy 40kg of spices. Her goals are to expand her activity and support her children’s education. So far, the spoilage of merchandise has hindered the development of her business.   

Kamwite wishes to thank the Hekima MFI for helping businesswomen to become self-sufficient who cannot use the traditional banking system, especially in these critical times of war in the Eastern region.

loans.use: to buy 40 kg of spices.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ester Maraza

texts.es: La señora Ester de 28 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos que dependen de sus ingresos. Se dedica a la elaboración de anticuchos y cuenta con una experiencia de 3 años en la actividad, pero tiene muchas ganas de superarse por ello solicita un crédito para comprar mesa, parrilla anticuchera, sillas, platos, etc. de esta manera podrá mejorar el servicio que ofrece y se incrementaran sus ventas para proporcionarle a su familia mayor bienestar.
texts.en: Ester is 28 years old, married and has two children who depend on her income. She makes kebabs for a living and has 3 years experience in this trade, but has ambitions to improve as she is requesting a loan to buy a table, kebab grill, chairs, plates, etc. In this way she will be able to improve the service that she offers and increase her sales to improve her family's well being.

loans.use: to buy a table, kebab grill, chairs, dishes, etc.

loans.name: Surja Maya

texts.en:
Surja Maya is 50 years old .  She is married and has one child, aged 30.  

In 2000, she established her grocery business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW and has used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. 

In the future, Surja Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  

By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her "pasal"

loans.name: Muniya

texts.en:
Muniya is 35 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 6.  In 2006, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business. 

 In the future, Manisha plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

 Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Dry Fish Sellers Group

texts.en:
Aminata is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aminata was born in Blama, eastern Sierra Leone, 37 years ago. She is married to a soldier and has three children who are attending primary and secondary school. 

Aminata has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells market-food – beans, rice, etc. 

With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a larger quantity of beans, rice, etc., to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of beans, rice, etc., to add to her current stock

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a businessman trading cattle in Nyakibingo in Kahungye in Bushenyi District and he has done this since 2011. The main objective of starting the business was to earn income which he would use to provide for his family. 

He would like to use the money from this loan to buy more cows for trade as he anticipates high profits in this festive season of Christmas. His clients are businessmen and farmers in the same area where he does the business and he says that his honesty has helped him to maintain his good customers. 

Justus's challenge is inadequate time since he spends less time at the farm as he is employed in a tea factory as a field supervisor where he gets additional income to sustain his family. Justus is very hopeful that his business will grow to greater heights, leading to an improvement in the standard of living of his family, especially if he is given a boost of a loan of one million shillings.

loans.use: To buy cows to trade

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 29 membres fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été créé le 28 décembre 2009. Il est composé des membres qui habitent le même quartier et les quartiers périphériques et qui leur inspirent confiance. Les membres vivent dans la bonne entente et sont solidaires. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Collé, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 67 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 04 filles. Sa principale activité est le commerce. Elle fait cette activité depuis très longtemps et a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. 
Elle s'approvisionne en légumes dans les marchés hebdomadaires et les revend au marché de sa localité. Elle achète : un demi sac de choux à 7500 F, un demi sac de manioc à 7500 F, deux seaux de bouillon (Mami) à 3600 F et (Garmi) à 4000 F, 01 Kg de poivre à 5000 F, 01 Kg d'ail à 1000 F, 50 Kg de navets à 250 F le Kg, 1/4 de sac de patates à 5000 F. Elle les revend à: 400 F le Kg de navet, 1000 F le Kg de chou, 300 F le Kg de manioc, 300 F le Kg de bouillon. Le bouillon génère un bénéfice de 1400 F par seau.
Les bénéfices réalisés sont destinés à la prise en charge de ses enfants d'autant plus qu'elle est veuve et aussi à renforcer son épargne dans le Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
This group of 29 members belongs to the Banc Villageois created 28 December 2009. It consists of people who live in a small cluster of neighborhoods and who trust each other. The members get along well and share a bond of solidarity. Their main activity is commerce.

Collé, age 67, is the group member standing on the right in the photo and raising her hand. She is a widowed mother of four daughters. Her main activity is the sale of vegetables. Having been a merchant for a very long time, she has acquired considerable experience in this sector.

Collé buys vegetables at the weekly markets and sells her stock at her local market. She plans to buy half a bag of cabbage for 7500 F, half a bag of cassava for 7500 F, two buckets of bouillon, Mami brand for 3600 F and Garmi brand for 4000 F, 1kg or pepper for 5000 F, 1kg of garlic for 1000 F, 50kg of turnips for 250 F per kg, and a quarter sack of potatoes for 5000 F. She will sell this merchandise at 400 F per kg of turnips, 1000 F per kg of cabbage, 300 F per kg of cassava, and 300 F per kg of bouillon. The bouillon brings her a profit of 1400 F per bucket.

She will use her profits to take care of her children, especially being a widow,  and to bolster her savings with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.es: El señor Douglas tiene 20 años de edad, está casado y no tiene hijos dependientes de sus ingresos, su actividad principal es la producción de leche cruda, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 2 años, se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable y tiene muchas ganas de superase, actualmente solicita un crédito para comprar cascara de soya para su ganado,  para alimentarlos bien y mantener el nivel de producción, de esta forma lograra  satisfacer sus necesidades económicas y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Douglas is 20, married, and does not have any dependent children. His main job is the production of raw milk, which he has been doing for 2 years. He is a responsible person with a great desire to do better.

Douglas is currently asking for a loan to buy soya hulls for his herd, in order to feed them well and maintain the level of milk production. In this way, he will be able to cover his economic needs and improve his way of life.

loans.use: to buy soya hulls for his herd.

loans.name: Mulongo

texts.en:
Mulongo is a married mother of nine children, four of whom attend school and five of whom are adults.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mulongo operates a cafe business, preparing food such as rice, tea, beans, and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge. Beside the cafe business, she sells clothes.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a stock of goods: maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods: maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a widow with one child, who is an adult. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia appreciates the previous loan, which improved her living standards. She was able to purchase more stocks of vegetables for her stall.

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase more vegetables, onions, and tomatoes for her business.  She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, onions, tomatoes for her stall

loans.name: Yainkain

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Yainkain. She is married but has no children. In 1993, Yainkain established her business, selling slippers and sandals. She began her business so that she could assist her husband in solving domestic problems. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Yainkain would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000 in order to buy more slippers and sandals for ladies. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 500,000. In the future, Yainkain plans to be an agent for one of the slipper factories in Guinea. She is very hardworking  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more slippers and sandals for ladies.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a  retail kiosk, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She cites price fluctuations as her major challenge. Amina dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the requested loan of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en: Clemence appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards by enabling her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of KES 15,000 to purchase potatoes and cooking oil for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Berta de 51 años de edad, es una mujer muy emprendedora, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos de edades ente 1, 5, 7 y 16 años de edad, ellos actualmente ayudan a su padre con los trabajos de la agricultura y 2 estudian en la escuela del cantón y el mayor estudia en la ciudad.

Berta se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero eso no le impide tener ese espíritu de emprendedurismo, así que en la familia a parte de la agricultura, también siembran hortalizas, y Berta pone crianza de pollos de engorde, más que todo para le época navideña; ya que es muy demandado por los consumidores del cantón.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 200 pollos de engorde, para que estén saliendo para el 31 de diciembre, ya que las ventas son muy buenas y toda la gente les gusta hacer panes rellenos con pollo.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos con una carrera universitaria, además quiere reparar su casa, para que sus futuros nietos puedan tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Berta is 51 years old. She is a very entrepreneurial woman. She lives with her husband and her four children ages 1, 5, 7, and 16. Today they help their father with the farming chores and two of them study in the town school. The eldest studies in the city.

Berta does domestic work for a living, but that does not allow her to have an entrepreneurial spirit, so in the agricultural part of the family they also grow vegetables. Berta raises broiler chickens, mostly for the Christmas season; as it is in high demand by the consumers of the town.

The loan that she is requesting of Fundación Campo, is to purchase 200 broiler chickens to be ready for December 31st as sales are good and all the people like her bread stuffed with chicken.

Her dream is to see her children with a college degree. Also she wants to repair her house so that her future grandchildren can have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase 200 broiler chickens to be ready for December 31st as sales are good and all the people like her bread stuffed with chicken.

loans.name: Humu

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Humu from the Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 1 child.  In 2011, Humu established her general store business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Humu requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks, and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and build a permanent business location. In the future, Humu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks, and pure water.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 25-year-old Zainab from the Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. One of her children is currently attending school. In 2000, Zainab established her used clothing business. She began her business because she wants to avoid idleness. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital.

Zainab requires a loan in order to buy more used clothing to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Zainab plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to expand her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man who has been blessed with three children who go to school. He lives at his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Joseph has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to his neighbors and villagers. His greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. For the Kshs 50,000 he wants to purchase charcoal for resale.  He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Sabenty Group

texts.en:
Aminata is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. 

Aminata was born in Kambia city 45 years ago. She is married to a businessman, and the couple has four children, one of whom is attending secondary school. 

Aminata sells palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil) and has been doing this business for many years now.

With the help of this loan, Aminata and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Aminata will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,000,000) to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Diana quien través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando. 
Diana se dedica a la venta de ropas variadas, que vende por su barrio, y con lo cual ayuda a su familia, ella es una persona muy sacrificada, que con esfuerzo y dedicación quiere salir adelante. Su sueño es poder tener su propia tienda de ropas e ir creciendo.
Pide este crédito para la compra de prendas variadas, como ser remeras, shorts, bermudas y demás, que le permitirá seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
San Cayetano is in its second loan cycle of the Women’s Communal Bank program, where all work and help each other to get ahead.

One of the members is Diana, who through effort and work continues the application of vital behavior of a successful woman; she is found to be improving.

Diana makes her living selling varied clothing that she sells in her neighborhood, and with which she helps her family. She is a very self-sacrificing person, with effort and dedication she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to be able to have her own clothing store and continue growing.

She is applying for this loan for the purchase of various clothes, like t-shirts, shorts, men’s shorts and more, that will allow her to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shorts, men's shorts and more.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice,  49 years old, lives in Garnersville with her husband and  her two children, ages 3 and 12 who are in school. For the past ten years she has been selling palm oil in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband,  and she enjoys her business because she makes more profit every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. She plans to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Hanneh

texts.en:
Hanneh is 31 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She’s married, and her husband is a businessman.  They have 3 children between 1 to 12 years old, who live at home; one attends school.

For the past five years, Hanneh has been selling charcoal.  She was taught how to run the business by her mother. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business.  Her plans are to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 34 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She’s married and her husband is a businessman. They have four children between 6 to 19 years old, who live at home and attend school. For the past eight years, Hawa has been selling cosmetics. She was taught how to run the business by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Ana Rubidia

texts.es:
Ana de 41 años de edad, esta casada, pero su esposo decidió emigrar hacia los estados unidos para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, ellos tienen 3 hijos de 5, 18 y 20 años de edad, todos viven en su casa, uno de ellos esta acompañado  y estudia a la vez; pero está por graduarse de bachiller, actualmente vive a parte con su compañera de vida, pero viven en la misma casa, ya que no cuenta con los recursos para ser independiente.

El trabajo de Ana  se centra en una mini-tienda que tiene desde hace 15 años en su casa y un molino que lo adquirió hace 11 años y que le costó mucho para adquirirlo, su hijo de 20 años de edad se encarga de cultivar granos básicos y los otros dos le ayudan con las ventas diarias y las dos molidas que hacen al día. Esta iniciativa productiva y de desarrollo que realizan a diario, surgió por la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos y así tener una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos.  

Con el préstamo que esta solicitando, es para surtir mas la tienda, ya que se viene la época navideña y es donde mejores ventas tiene, además piensa invertir una parte en juegos pirotécnicos, que no son peligrosos al momento de ser manipulados por los niños.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos que se puedan valer por sí mismos y tengan una carrera universitaria. Además, quiere reparar su casa, para que sus futuros nietos puedan tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old, and married, but her husband decided to emigrate to the United States in order to provide a better quality of life for their children. She has 3 children who are 5, 18, and 20 years old. They all live at home. One of them has a life partner and is a student, but he is about to graduate from school. Although living together with his life companion, he does not have the resources to live independently.

Ana has a mini-store that she has had in her home for 15 years and a mill that she bought 11 years ago and which was expensive to buy. Her 20 year old son is in charge of growing basic grains and the other two help with daily sales and grinding. She began this daily productive initiative because of the need to improve her income and to have a better quality of life for her children.

With the loan that she is requesting she will buy more supplies for the store, as the Christmas season is approaching and this is when she has more sales.  She is also thinking of investing in some fireworks which are not dangerous when children handle them.

Her dream is to see her children be self supporting and have a university degree. She also wants to repair her house so that her future grandchildren will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store, as the Christmas season is approaching when she had better sales, and she is also thinking of investing in some fireworks which are not dangerous when children handle them.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet Adama, she is a 39-year-old from Waterloo2 in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with 1 child.  In 2012, Adama established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the poor network within her operation area.

Adama requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Adama plans to open a food stuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Meet Alice, a 27-year-old woman from the Waterloo2 Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. In 2006, Alice established her retail business because she wanted to develop her standard of living. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation problems.

Alice requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of groundnuts to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Alice plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of groundnuts to expand her business.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Mariatu from the Waterloo2 Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. She started her business to empower herself and her children.
 
Mariatu runs a retail business. She sells pepper to residents of her community, and she has been running this business since 2010. She works 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Mariatu says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Mariatu has requested a loan in order to purchase food commodities like seasonings, oil, and bagged pepper to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living. In the future, she plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you.

loans.use: to purchase seasonings, oil, and bagged pepper to expand her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 28 years old and married with 2 children. She runs a retail business in the Waterloo2 Eastern area in Freetown. She started the business because she wants to improve the condition of her family.  

Isatu has been in this business since after the war. She sells groundnuts within her community. She says that the main problem for her business is transportation from the town to her area of operation.

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more bags of groundnuts to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of groundnuts to expand her business

loans.name: Massa

texts.en: Massa is 40 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and her husband is a carpenter. They have five children between 3 to 20 years old, who live at home and attend school. For the past 15 years, Massa has been selling fish from a table in the local market. She was taught how to run the business by her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Meet Susan, she is 45 years old from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children. 

In 2008, Susan established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are a poor network within her operation area and transportation.

Susan requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Susan plans to own a big palm oil store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Aminata from Waterloo2 Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2008, Aminata established her slippers business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says the main challenge to her business is that moving door-to-door to introduce her goods is very difficult.

Aminata requires a loan in order to buy more slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Aminata plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 23-year-old Isatu from Waterloo2 eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 2 children. She started her business to take care of her family. 

Isatu runs a food stand business at home. She sells rice, tomatoes and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since 2009. Isatu works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. She says that the main challenges to her business are price, transportation and insufficient finance to expand her business.

Isatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, tomatoes and cooking seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, tomatoes and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet Adama.  She is 40 years old and from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with six children.  

In 2004, Adama established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income.   She works at the business from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Adama requires a loan in order to purchase more fertilizer and farm seeds to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business.

In the future, Adama plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and farm seeds to expand her business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Marie from Waterloo2 eastern rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with five children. She started her business to take care of her family. 

Marie runs a retail business at home.  She sells charcoal, palm oil, and cooking oil. 

She has been running this business since 2008. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Marie says that the main challenges to her business are price transportation and insufficient finance to expand her business.

Marie has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like charcoal, palm oil, and cooking oil. 

The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like charcoal, palm oil, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Celia Sara

texts.es: La señora Celia de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien actualmente se encuentra de viaje y tiene 3 hijos que dependen de sus ingresos. Se dedica a la producción de leche cruda  y ya que es un actividad familiar, para la alimentación y recolección cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, ahora solicita un crédito para comprar cascara de soya para su ganado, debido a que en esta época del año escasea el alimento y es muy poca la producción de forraje, de esta manera logrará mantener el nivel de su producción para satisfacer sus necesidades y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Celia is 34 years old. She lives with her husband who is away traveling at the moment. She has 3 children who are dependent on what she earns. Her work is producing raw milk, and since this is a family activity her children help with the nurturing and gathering. 

She is currently requesting a loan to buy soybean hulls for her cattle because at this time of the year food is scarce and there is little forage being produced. In this way she can maintain her level of production in order to satisfy her needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy soybean hulls for her cattle

loans.name: Deddeh

texts.en:
Deddeh lives in Gardnersville, is 40 years old, and she did not attend school. She is married with three children aged between 13 and 22 years old. Her husband is a teacher. 

For the past two years she has been selling bath and washing soap, toothpaste, groundnuts and other items. She started this business with money given to her by her oldest  son and learned this way of selling from her friends. She likes the way her business keeps her in one place, and the selling makes her proud. She is requesting a  loan to purchase more bath and washing soap, toothpaste, groundnuts, and other items for her business. In future she wants to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bath and washing soap, toothpaste, groundnuts, and other items for her business

loans.name: Fatoumata Sakou's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc villageois est né le 15 Décembre 2008 à l'occasion de son inauguration. Ce groupement malgré les difficultés qu’il vit est composé de femmes d’une détermination sans faille, c’est dans cette lancé qu’elles viennent d’entamer leur dixième cycle. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la transformation de produits agricoles. Elles  vivent  toutes dans le même village. 
 
Madame Fatoumata  (assise à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans, mariée  et mère de 05 enfants dont 02 filles et 03  garçons. Son activité s’inscrit dans la vente de tissus teinté communément appelés «thioub», cette dernière est cumulée  à la vente de patte d’arachide activité très rentable dans la zone. Raison pour la quelle ce prêt sera exclusivement utiliser à l’achat de graine d’arachide pour la transformation.

Son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des sacs de graines d’arachide non décortiqués pour la transformation en patte d’arachide.

 Les bénéfices seront utilisés pour appuyer son mari  dans la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was inaugurated on December 15, 2008. It consists of women who show unrelenting determination despite challenging circumstances, and who have therefore managed to reach their 10th loan cycle. Their main activities are small trade and the processing of farming products. They all live in the same village.

Mrs. Fatoumata, age 46, is the featured borrower for this group. She is seen in the photo sitting at the far right. She is the married mother of five children, two girls and three boys. She is a reseller of a dyed fabric called thioub, and she also sells groundnut paste, a highly profitable activity in the area, which is why she will use this new loan exclusively to purchase groundnuts to process into paste. 

She plans to buy sacks of unshelled groundnuts for processing into groundnut paste. 

She will use her profits to assist her husband in supporting their children’s education.

loans.use: to buy sacks of unshelled groundnuts for processing into groundnut paste.

loans.name: Leydi Yasenia

texts.es:
Leydi de 32 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos (tres varones y una hembra), la primera 11 años de edad que estudia 5ªgrado en el mismo cantón,  el segundo tiene 9 años hace 3ª grado de estudio, el tercer niño tienen 4 años y el ultimo 3 días de nacido.
Ella esta casada, el esposo trabaja en la distribución de productos de la canasta básica. Él viaja desde el lugar donde vive hasta la ciudad durante cuarenta minutos en automóvil.    

Leydi tiene experiencia de 9  años de tener una pequeña tienda y la tiene instalada en la propia casa y así no descuida a la familia y es una forma de ayudar a los gastos del hogar. El esposo se involucra también, yaqué es quien trae los comprados semanales de la tienda.
Con el crédito comprara una cerda parindera y el resto del dinero será para mejorar el chiquero de los cerdos; porque están muy pequeño donde están,  a la ves es otro ingreso que estará percibiendo. Así ayudar a un poco más a los gastos porque se están incrementando con la llegada de otro niño.   

Cabe mencionar que con este nuevo negocio mejorara la calidad de vida, porque tendrá mas ingresos y así darle a los hijos lo que ella no tuvo, cuando era chiquita, comenta que eran demasiado pobres eran 7 hermanos por todos.        

A futuro le gustaría seguir  trabajado  muy fuerte, para alcanzar los objetivos propuestos, que  es darle estudio a las hijos de ella,  para que puedan enfrentar la vida diferente, ella también tiene otro sueño que es mejorar la humilde vivienda y pide a Diós vida y fuerzas para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Leydi, 32, is a mother of four children (three boys and one girl). The eldest, 11, studies in 5th grade in the same area. The second, 9, is in 3rd grade; the third child is 4 and the youngest is 3 days old.

She is married, the husband works in the distribution of basic goods. He travels from the place where he lives to the city by car for forty minutes.

Leydi has 9 years’ experience owning a small store and she has it installed in her own house. This way, she can care for the family and it is a way of helping with the expenses of the home. The husband is involved as well, given that he is the one who brings the weekly purchases to the store.

With the loan, she will buy a female pig and the rest of the money will be for improving the pig pen, because it is very small where they are. At the same time it is another revenue she can expect. In this manner, she will help with expenses a little more because they are increasing with the arrival of another child.

It’s worth mentioning that with this new income she will improve her quality of life, because she will have more income and therefore give her children what she didn’t have. When she was young, she remarks that they were too poor: in total they were 7 siblings.

In the future, she would like to continue working really hard to reach her proposed objectives: give her children the chance to study, so that they can confront life differently. She also has another dream which is to improve her humble home and she asks God for the life and strength to do it.

loans.use: to buy a female pig and improving the pig pen.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata, she is a 35-year-old from the Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children.  In 2008, Fatmata established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income.   She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the poor network within her operation area.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more bananas to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a food stuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to expand her business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de condición económica humilde, el cual cada día se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante, es por ello que con mucho ahorro y esfuerzo logro iniciar su negocio de reparación y renovación de calzado, con el cual puede tener ingresos para solventar sus gastos.

Carlos eta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales como plantillas, pegamento, cuero, entre otros; de esta manera tendra los materiales para poder trabajar y atender mejor a sus clientes, así seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una casa propia y poder tener una gran fábrica de zapatos”.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young man of limited economic conditions, who works very hard every day to get ahead in life. With a lot of effort he was able to save money and he opened up his shoe repair shop; this is how he earns an income to cover his expenses. 

Carlos is grateful with Kiva lenders because thanks to the help offered, he will be able to buy materials like shoe soles, glue, and leather, among other, in order to have the supplies to work and serve his clientele more efficiently. This is how he will continue to strive to make his big dream a reality: own a house and open a big shoe factory.

loans.use: to buy materials like shoe soles, glue, leather, etc.

loans.name: Carla Ibeth

texts.es: La señora Carla de 32 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos, se dedica a prestar sus servicios como cocinera en la rosticería "Victoria", donde ya trabaja desde hace dos años, se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable y tiene muchas ganas de superarse, ahora solicita un crédito para comprar muebles para su hogar con el fin de darle mayor comodidad a sus hijos y proporcionarles un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Carla is 32 years old, she lives with her two sons and works as a cook in a restaurant (“Rotisserie Victoria”), where she has been working during the last 2 years. She is known as a very responsible person, with lots of will to get ahead in life. 

She is requesting this loan to buy furniture for her home, in order to offer greater comfort to her sons, and improve the living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her home.

loans.name: Kethegbeh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Kathegbeh” group. They are two small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 1,500,000 for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Adama is the featured leader of this group. Adama was born in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a lorry driver, and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Adam sells "Yoruba items" (locally made or produced items like creams and body lotion, jewelry and rings, earrings, native grains, eye shadow, etc.) and has been doing this business for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Adam will invest in her business by buying the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy creams and body lotions, jewelry and rings, earrings, native grains, eye shadow, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Herber Isaac

texts.es:
Herber de 25 años de edad, es soltero. Él ha realizado sus estudios a nivel técnico en computación, con ayuda económica de su madre y primos que viven en estados unidos; actualmente trabaja la agricultura con su abuelo y de vez en cuando realiza trabajos de reparación de computadoras.

su familia que esta conformada por su madre y su abuelo. Su madre se dedica a los oficios domésticos y su abuelo a trabajos de agricultura, de esta manera trabajando unidos han podido salir adelante y logrado sacar los estudios del joven Herber.
    

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde pequeño,  actividad que aprendió de su abuelo y tiene una experiencia de 15 años. Ademas, con el tiempo se le presento la oportunidad de optar por estudiar una carrera técnica en computación.
