This makes planning the work difficult, and also leaves her little time for the actual orders to be completed. To be able to better plan the work and deliver better quality services she would like to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine. To be able to afford the purchases she is taking a group loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a small generator and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: El señor Salome A.B. es un hombre trabajador y dedicado a su familia su mayor sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y dejar en sus hijos como herencia el amor al trabaja (agricultura) el credito lo solicita para comprar insumos y fertilizantes necesarios como: Insectisidas, Funjisida, Triple, Completo, todos estos para darle un optimo mantenimiento a su cosecha de Piña y Pitahaya, ya que el desea aprovechar las lluvias que han pasado para que le hagan un limpieza y luego darle mantenimiento, Agradece el apoyo que ha a recibido de Kiva y Afodenic en estos ultimos creditos.
texts.en:
Salome A.B. Is a hard-working man, dedicated to his family. His greatest dream is to improve their living conditions and to instill in his children as a legacy, the love for working in agriculture.

He is requesting the loan to buy necessary agricultural supplies and fertilizers such as: insecticides, fungicides, herbicides; all these to provide optimal maintenance to his pineapple and dragonfruit crop. This is because he wishes to take advantage of the rains that have occurred to do clearing and then do maintenance. 

He is grateful for the support he has received from Kiva and Afodenic in previous loans.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Doña  Amanda es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a su familia en una comunidad en la zona sur  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de Rosquillas y cuajada el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha. 
Doña Amanda necesita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima como leche, sal,  harina, soda, leña, etc. para seguir elaborando sus rosquillas y cuajada de esta manera contar con este ingreso el cual es muy importante para su hogar.
Doña Amanda espera gracias al  préstamo poder contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos. Ella espera que su negocio.  
Doña Amanda su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más reconocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Noviembre  del  2013
texts.en:
Amanda is a very hard working and responsible person; she lives with her family in a community located in the southern region of Honduras. She makes and sells “rosquillas” (corn flour pastries) and “cuajada”  (a milk curd/cheese product), which are well known foods in her community, and there is high demand for them.

Amanda hopes that thanks to this loan she will be able to obtain the supplies to continue with her business, and respond to the customers’ requests. She expects that the sales will increase, and this will reflect positively in her family's quality of life.

Her dream is that her business continues to increase, becoming the most popular in her city, so that she may continue to support her family.

loans.use: to buy milk, salt, flour, baking soda, wood, etc.

loans.name: Fernando Luigui

texts.es:
Fernando vive en la ciudad Pucallpa, se dedica a agricultura desde hace 10 años y actualmente ha sembrado yuca y plátano; a Fernando le gusta mucho lo que hace por ello se esfuerza cada día para poder salir adelante.

Fernando esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá comprar  comprar abono, fertilizantes, entre oros para poder mejorar su cultivo y poder obtener una buena cosecha; asi mejorara su calidad de vida y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño: “ser un gran agricultor”.
texts.en:
Fernando lives in the city of Pucallpa. He has earned his living doing agriculture for 10 years, and currently grows yuca and banana. Fernando likes what he does a lot, so he works hard every day to get by.

Fernando is grateful for Kiva lenders, as thanks to their help he will be able to buy compost, ferilizers and other to be able to improve his crop and have a good harvest. In this way, he will improve his quality of life and work hard to make his grand dream a reality - "to be a great farmer."

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost, among others.

loans.name: Willian Rafael

texts.es:
Willian es un joven de 23 años de edad, lleno de energía  y ganas de salir adelante, en su infancia vivió momentos difíciles dado que solamente pudo estudiar hasta 6°  grado, pues sus padres tenían miedo de que la delincuencia lo atrapara en sus garras. Actualmente vive con sus padres y hermanos, hace  2 años consiguió trabajo en la alcaldía, en el área de mantenimiento fue  así que decidió acompañarse, su pareja  con quien  tiene un bebe de 6 meses de nacido. 

Él tiene  2 años de trabaja en la alcaldía,  específicamente como ayudante de albañil, este trabajo  lo aprendió con su papá quien desde pequeño le enseño a él  y sus hermanos a trabajar para pudieran salir adelante.

El préstamo será utilizado, para la construcción de vivienda, los materiales que comprara serán: cemento, ladrillos, lamina, hierro, el trabajo de construir la vivienda lo realizara él  y sus hermanos ya que cuentan con la experiencia para hacerlo.

En el futuro piensa prepararse más en el trabajo de albañilería y así poder tomar trabajos independientes, que le permitan tener mayores ingresos parta salir adelante  con su familia.
texts.en:
William, 23, is full of energy and desire to get out ahead. As a child, he had some difficult times given that he was only able to study until 6th grade. His parents were afraid that he would get caught up in crime. Now he lives with his parents and siblings. He has been working in city hall for 2 years in maintenance. He has a partner and they have a 6-month-old baby.

He has been working in city hall for 2 years, namely as a builder’s assistant. He learned this work from his father who taught him and his brothers when they were young so that they could come out ahead.

The loan will be used to construct his house. The materials to be purchased are: cement, bricks, sheet metal and iron. He and his brothers will do the work as they have experience. 

In the future, William thinks of working in construction and so he can get independent jobs, which will allow him to receive higher income in order to have his family come out ahead.

loans.use: to construct his house. The materials to be purchased are: cement, bricks, sheet metal and iron.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is 32 years old and single. Juvelyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Juvelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like candies, snack foods, bath soap, detergent soap, noodles, etc. to sell.

Juvelyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as candies, snack foods, bath soap, detergent soap, noodles, etc. 

Juvelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like candies, snack foods, bath soap, detergent soap, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 37 and a mother of six children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
She is a very hard working and honest person. Her husband owns a small restaurant in which he offers various types of delicious foods twice a day. He has been running this restaurant for many years and earns a good profit from the restaurant business. She helps her husband by cooking various foods at home for her husband to sell at his restaurant. He offers tea to his customers as well. Now he wants to establish his restaurant by purchasing new plastic furniture, utensils, a cauldron etc. Due to their household expenses, his savings are not enough to buy the desired things.

Therefore, Shamim requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy plastic furniture, utensils, a cauldron etc. She thanks Kiva and appreciates their warm support.

loans.use: To buy furniture, utensils, a cauldron, spices etc for the restaurant.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is a resident of Ruhindo, in the Rukungiri District. For the past nine years, he has been dealing in produce, mainly matooke (bananas). Herbert buys from farmers and sells to neighboring trading centers, markets, and the Rukungiri Municipality. He has a ready market for his matooke because he has customers that he supplies on a daily basis. 

Herbert is requesting a loan to buy more matooke to satisfy his customers who increase in number day by day. His dream for the future is to buy a vehicle which will make his transportation easier and save time to serve his customers better. Herbert will also get higher profits for his personal development. He appears in this photograph with the loan officer.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 66 years old and is married with one child. For the past eight years, she has run a food-vending business in the Philippines. Lucia is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lucia is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and materials for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 49 years old and lives in Poblacion 2, Oroquieta City. She has a meat shop where she earns a meager income of PHP 10,000 per month. She has been doing this type of work for eight years now.

Amy is eyeing to expand her business. She has requested a loan to buy kilos of meat to sell. She thinks this can help her boost her income when she has enough inventories to sell.

Amy wants to maintain her membership with PMPC on a good record. She deeply wishes to pay her obligations in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy kilos of meat to sell

loans.name: Marionito

texts.en: Marionito owns and operates a farm to plant and harvest corn.  He earns a living by selling his corn in the local community. He has been in this business for six years and has earned enough for the family and to successfully repay his previous loan from GDMPC. He requests a new loan  to purchase organic pesticides  and  fertilizer. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase organic pesticides  and  fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 29 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Baybay Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Rosalyn runs a fish-selling business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of PMPC for almost two years.

Rosalyn is requesting a loan to purchase additional materials to repair her house. In the future, she hopes to improve her livelihood to be able to provide more services for her clients and give her children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair her house

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old. She lives in Binuangan, Oroquieta City and works as a rice farmer. She and her husband do not make enough income from their rice field to sustain their family’s needs. Therefore, also Jocelyn sells rice to help her husband.  

Jocelyn is requesting a loan from PMPC to purchase bags of rice to sell. She hopes to expand her business and hopes to see all of her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. She has run her business for the past five years and earns well. Anabella also works selling groceries in her general store. She has successfully repaid her previous GDMPC loans. 

Anabella is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries to sell. She plans to use the revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Liecil

texts.en:
Liecil is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liecil is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Liecil has a general store business in the Philippines. Liecil requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Liecil has been in this business for five years. In the future, Liecil would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 38 years old and married with six children. For the past three years, she has run a general store and she also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Lucia works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid eight previous loans from NWTF.

Lucia is requesting a 9,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks such as dried fish, milk, soy sauce, vinegar, canned goods, laundry soap, and other items to sell. In the future, she aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish, milk, soy sauce, vinegar, canned goods, laundry soap, and other items

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris operates a restaurant and sells food from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is price fluctuation. Damaris has received a previous loan that she used to buy ingredients for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Damaris is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar

loans.name: Basti

texts.en:
Basti is 42. She is an honest and kind woman who has been working in the agriculture sphere for more than 12 years. She makes an income from animal husbandry, fattening livestock at home with the help of her family. She is married and the mother of two children. Her husband works as a teacher in a secondary school and earns a small salary. For this reason, Basti is the family's main breadwinner.

She has dreamed about repairing their house for a long time. However, they don't have enough money to do so. That is why Basti is taking a loan of 500 AZN to buy cement, wood and so forth. She is relying on your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair their house.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
Carmelo, se dispone a sembrar y necesita capital para invertir en la compra de abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas e insecticidas, ya que son los insumos necesarios para preparar la tierra. 
Con el préstamo don Carmelo, invirtió un la compra de insumos agrícolas necesarios para sembrar maíz y frijoles, lo que le dio una cosecha abundante, granos de calidad, sus ventas aumentaron, su economía mejoro, por lo que ha podido cancelar las deudas, mejorar su vivienda y sobre todo ha seguido apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Carmelo is preparing to plant, and needs working capital to invest in the purchase of fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides, as these are the supplies needed to prepare the land.

With the previous loan, Carmelo purchased agricultural supplies needed to grow corn and beans, which gave him an abundant harvest and quality crops. His sales increased and his finances improved, so he has  been able to pay off some debts and improve his home. Above all, he has continued helping his children with their education.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides and insecticides.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a member in good standing with PMPC. She makes it a point to pay her obligations to the cooperative on time. At the age of 49, she opened her rice retail business in Tuyabang Alto, Oroquieta City.  Through a meager income of 7,000 PHP per month, Mercy is able to support the needs of her family. 

As Mercy continues her two-year membership with PMPC, she applied for a loan to buy additional rice to sell. Mercy wishes to pay her obligations to the cooperative and save portions of her income to build a decent home.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en: Jessa is from Dolipos Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is a 35-year-old, happily married woman with three children. She buys and sells rice in the market. She has many costumers that pay a good amount for the rice. However, because the price of rice has increased, Jessa needs to have additional capital to meet the needs of her consumers. She would like a loan from Paglaum MPC to meet these needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice to sell.

loans.name: Darikhan

texts.ru: Дарихан 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Сыновья находятся в России на заработках, а младшая дочь -школьница. У Дарихан - среднее образование, работает в качестве технички в сельской управе, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Дарихан занимается животноводством и садоводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 овец и яблоневый сад, который приносит хороший урожай. Супруг реализует яблоки за наличный расчет реализаторам на местном рынке. Ежемесячный доход составляет 2,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Дарихан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Дарихан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на достижение стабильного финансового состояния.
texts.en: Darikhan is 43 years old and married. She and her husband have four children. Her sons are now in Russia as migrant workers, and the youngest daughter attends secondary school. Darikhan has received secondary education. She works as a janitor at the village administrative office. As an additional source of income for her family, Darikhan raises livestock and gardens. She started this business 20 years ago by buying livestock for 3,000 KGS. Her husband helps her out on the farm. Thanks to Darikhan's hard work, her farm now includes eight sheep and an apple orchard producing a good harvest. Her monthly income is 2,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Darikhan has turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance  institution for a loan to increase her livestock by buying a cow. Darikhan plans to invest the resulting income into a further headcount increase, and plans to grow her savings so as to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Betty Roxana

texts.es:
Betty es una mujer de 35 años de edad, dedicada a su familia, es ama de casa, desde muy corta edad su madre la formo como una persona al servicio de su familia, por este motivo solo estudio hasta 4 grado, lo que le sirvió para aprender a leer  y escribir, además de dedicarse a ser ama de casa le ayuda a elaborar artesanías a una vecina, quien le paga por este servicio; vive con su compañero de vida, que se dedica a trabajar como hornero en una panadería en la ciudad. También, vive con ellos su hija de 10 años, quien actualmente ha cursado el 5° grado de estudio básico.    

La elaboración de artesanías, lo aprendió en un taller hace 10 años  y le da un ingreso extra.

El préstamo será utilizado, para construir un cuarto adicional en su casa y lo que comprara será: hierro, cemento, ladrillos y arena, además del pago  de la mano  de obra. 

En el futuro  espera iniciar con su propio establecimiento de artesanías, ya que es una actividad
que le gusta mucho, y estará enseñando  a su hija a trabajar en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Betty is a woman of 35, dedicated to her family. She is a housewife and from a very young age her mother trained her to be a person who looked after her family. For this reason she only went as far as the fourth grade, which enabled her to learn to read and write. 

In addition to being a housewife, she helps a neighbor make crafts, and this person pays for this service. She lives with her life companion, who works as a baker in a local bakery.  As well, their 10-year-old daughter lives with them, and she has now gone as far as fifth grade of primary school. 

She learned to make crafts in a workshop 10 years ago, and it gives her an extra income. 

The loan will be used to build an additional room on her home. She will buy: rebar, cement, bricks and sand, as well as pay for labor. In the future she hopes to start her own craft shop, as it is an activity she really likes, and she will be teaching her daughter to work in this activity.

loans.use: To build an additional room on her home. She will buy: rebar, cement, bricks, sand, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Rodolfo Jose

texts.es:
Rodolfo de 28 años de edad, soltero, originario de Managua,  es la capital de Nicaragua.  Se caracteriza por ser un joven dinámico trabajador, con ganas de superación personal.  En la actualidad, sus sueños es poder hacer crecer su negocio en los tres primeros anos.

Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de medicina, de forma ambulante. El dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias, tiene dos años de haber iniciado su negocio al cual le está dedicando cien por ciento su tiempo. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra  y venta de medicamentos genéricos y éticos como jarabes, inyecciones pastillas, vitaminas, cremas, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  En la foto podemos observa al joven la cajas de medicamente la cual distribuye Rodolfo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 28 years old, single, and from Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. He is a dynamic and hardworking youth, with a desire to excel. Currently, his dream is to grow his business in the first three years. 

Thanks to his desire to succeed, he earns a living by selling medicine as a street vendor. He works 12 hours a day. He started the business 2 years ago, and dedicates a hundred percent of his time to it. 

His plan is to invest the loan in the buying and selling of generic, ethical medicines, such as syrups, injections, pills, vitamins, creams, so that he might earn more money in the future. 

In the photo, we can see Rodolfo with boxes of the medicines that he distributes. Rodolfo is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they might have decent employment.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to buy and sell medicines such as syrups, injections, pills, vitamins, creams.

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda is married and has run a sewing business for the last twelve years in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 
Ma. Linda is requesting a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as fabric, thread, and zippers for her business.

In the future, Ma. Linda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional material such as fabric, thread, and zippers for her business

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 35-year-old married father of two children who has been working as a barber for sixteen years. He also owns a small bus which he runs for transportation services as an additional income business to improve  his family's standard of living and increase his income.

Mahmoud is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to perform necessary maintenance on the van (small bus) that he owns and runs for transportation services.

Mahmoud hopes to open a spare auto parts shop in the future to improve his socioeconomic situation.  He likes his current business because he has a lot of experience and it can be managed with a  small amount of capital.   However, he is currently working hard to develop a new career.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance on the van he owns and runs for his transportation business.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem, 45, is married and the father of three children. He has been working in the construction business for twenty-five years. Kassem specializes in the cement business. He also works as a school bus driver to generate additional income for his family.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a car. The car will ease his business's transportation needs. Kassem hopes to keep on developing his business and one day have a construction company that does all phases of construction.

loans.use: to buy a car for his business

loans.name: Fe Glenda

texts.en:
Fe Glenda is 38 years old and married. She lives at Barangay 7, Polao, Tangub City, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from her neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in the profits upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending on their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she has decided to raise pigs on her own as well. 

Through Pauglam MPC, Fe Glenda obtained the capital to purchase her own piglets and feed. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy additional feeds and pigs. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to her husband's income. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to more easily maintain sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos (maíz y frijol), está acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y su hija de 27 años de edad, todos dependen de los ingresos que don José genera con dicha actividad, es un oficio que aprendió de su papá desde que era niño. Su trabajo lo realiza desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m. Su mayor ventaja es que siembra en tierras propias y por el momento no ha tenido ningún problema en realizarla.
Invertirá en el pago de mano de obra para limpiar el terreno sembrar y luego recolectar la cosecha, espera aumentar su producción, aumentar sus ventas, tener granos de calidad y tener más clientes satisfechos.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, para poder ofrecer a su familia una mejor alimentación, salud y vestuario.
texts.en:
José makes a living growing basic grains (corn and beans).  He has a partner and lives with her and his 27-year-old daughter.  The three family members depend on José's income.  He learned his trade when he was a young boy, from his father.  José works from 6am until 3pm.  The advantage José has in his work is that he has his own land and, so far, he has not had any problems in this activity.  José will use this loan to pay labourers to clean the land, sow crops, and later collect the harvest.  José hopes to increase production, to increase his sales, to produce good quality grains, and to have more satisfied customers.

José's dream is to expand his business in order to offer his family better food, better health, and better clothes.

loans.use: to pay labourers to clean the land, sow crops, and later collect the harvest.

loans.name: Amada Julia

texts.es: Amada es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega, tiene 48 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio con este negocio hace 7 años vendiendo frescos naturales; poco a poco iba creciendo su negocio hasta lograr obtener su pulpería. Actualmente con la ayuda de su esposo ha logrado a salir adelante con este negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar: granos básicos, golosinas, frutas y verduras, con el fin de crecer su negocio y aumentar sus productos. Estima que este crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá aumentar la clientela y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Amada is originally from the city of Chinandega. She is 48 years old and has 4 children who are independent now. She is a shop-keeper who has a convenience store. She started this business 7 years ago selling natural juices, and gradually grew the business until setting up the convenience store. With the help of her husband, the business has done well. 

She is requesting the loan in order to buy basic grains, snacks, fruit, and vegetables, with the goal of growing her business and increasing the products she sells. She believes that this loan will be of much help, as it will help her increase her clientele and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional sugar, cooking oil, bananas, and other ingredients for her food vending business.

Adelina has been in this business for 4 years. She earns more income from buying and selling charcoal and raising chickens.

Adelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sugar, cooking oil, bananas, and other ingredients

loans.name: Mayra Del Transito

texts.es:
Mayra de 37 años de edad,  estudio hasta 6 grado de educación, es madre soltera de un hijo y ellos viven con sus padres.

Ella se dedica al destazo de reses, desde hace 20 años;  su madre de ella le enseño esta actividad ya que como familia ha sido un legado que comenzaron los abuelos de la cliente y que ella aun hoy en día sigue manteniendo.  Además, es una forma de trabajo que ella encontró viable para ayudar a sus padres y estar criando a su hijo,  ella no ha tenido, ni tiene otra fuente económica solo la antes mencionada su negocio lo tiene en su casa pero muchas veces le toca salir a vender a la colonia y el costo mayor es traer la materia prima para realizar su labor; para acercarlo tiene que recorrer 23 kilómetros en carro, su madre de ella a veces se involucra porque por la edad ya no le es posible solventar el trabajo como antes. El horario de trabajo es de 6 horas diarias.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar una res, para  seguir vendiendo. Mejorará los ingresos de ella, porque  tendrá la oportunidad de  vender más y así colaborara de mejor manera con los gastos de la casa,

Sus sueños son encontrar un trabajo estable,  para darle a su familia una vida digna y para su familia su sueño es ayudarlos a que cumplan sus sueños y para su hijo es verlo crecer y que estudie y encuentre un trabajo que le permita vivir como una vida digna.  El préstamo le ayudara a tener una mejor venta y cubrir la demanda que tiene dentro de su comunidad, con la ganancia ampliara su negocio y lo hará instalando un puesto de venta dentro del mercado municipal para tener una mejor venta.
texts.en:
Mayra is 37 years old. She studied until the 6th grade. She is a single mother of one child, and they live with her parents. She has been earning a living by butchering cows for the past 20 years. Her mother taught her this work, as it has been in her family since her grandparents started doing it, and now she continues it. It is a line of work that she finds to be suitable to support her parents and raise her child. She has never had any other source of income. 

She works at home, but she often leaves the house to sell in the neighborhood. The biggest cost for her is bringing in the raw material in order to do her work: in order to bring it home, she has to travel 23 kilometers by car. Her mother helps occasionally, but due to her age she cannot work as much as she used to. The work day is 6 hours long.

The loan that Mayra is requesting will be used to buy a cow so that she can continue selling. This will increase her income as she will be able to sell more and help pay the household expenses. Mayra's dream is to find a stable job so that her family can have a dignified life. Her dream is to help her family to achieve their dreams and to see her son grow, study, and find a decent job. 

This loan will help her sell more and meet the demand within her community. With an increased income, she will expand her business and put up a stall in the municipal market in order to sell more.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to continue selling meat.

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
José, solicita capital para pagar mano de obra para recolectar la cosecha de maíz, también adquirirá materia prima para seguir elaborando hamacas, le servirá para tener sus pedidos tanto de granos básicos como de las hamacas.
Con el préstamo anterior él tuvo el material necesario para elaborar una mayor cantidad de hamacas, atrajo a más clientes, sus ventas aumentaron y sus nuevos ingresos le han permitido salir de deudas y cambiar el estilo de vida de su famila.
texts.en:
José is applying for this loan in order to pay labourers to harvest his corn.  He will also use it to continue producing hammocks.  The loan will help José with the orders that he has for both hammocks and basic grains.

José used his previous loan to produce a larger number of hammocks.  He attracted more customers, his sales increased, and his income allowed him to get out of debt and change his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay labourers to harvest corn.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie, 51, lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. She sells eggs on a retail basis and earns approximately PHP 4,000 a month. Her income allows her to provide for her family's food needs. 

She has approached PMPC for a loan to buy additional inventory for her business. Increasing her inventory will help ensure good sales. Josie deeply hopes that she can continue to provide food for her family. She also strives to remain a member in good standing of the cooperative.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 35 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail curtains and fosters business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of curtains and fosters to sell.

Genelyn has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the curtains and fosters business for 9 years and also earns an income from buying and selling dry goods and raising chickens.

Genelyn aspires to save enough money so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of curtains and fosters to sell

loans.name: Hassane

texts.en:
Hassane is a 59-year-old married father of two children. He has been working in his convenience store since three years ago, which is his only source for living.

Hassane is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to increase his business merchandise with special offer items, which will improve his income and develop his living.

He is seeking perfection in his business in order to develop his family's socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special offer items.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en:
Asmat, 34, lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mason by profession. He has been constructing buildings and houses for twenty years. As an expert, he has constructed many beautiful buildings. 

Asmat's husband uses many construction tools, including the brick trowel, buttering trowel, pointing trowel, hammer, chisel, jointer, and level. His tools are wearing out and he needs to buy new tools to continue his trade. However, he does not have sufficient funds. Therefore, Asmat is requesting a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to enable her husband to buy the necessary construction tools. She thanks Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy construction tools for her husband

loans.name: Esau

texts.en:
Esau, married with four children, lives in a trading center with his wife and children. Having no source of income and yet children in school, Esau started riding a motorcycle that belonged to someone else to ferry people for a fee. He later saved some money, which he used to start a small cosmetics shop for his wife to bring additional income to the family. 

He has applied for a loan so that he can increase the working capital of the cosmetics shop and provide a variety of items for his customers this season. He is a hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Hassane

texts.en:
Hassane is a 40-year-old married father of four children. He has been working in the tailoring sector since nineteen years ago. In 2004, he started running his current factory, and he always works hard on developing it.

Hassane's business is going on just fine, and he makes sure to keep on responding to the market needs and requests. And since it's the Holy month preparations, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy the necessary threads and textiles for his factory.

Through his previous Al Majmoua loan, Hassane was able to buy special tailoring machines that improved his business and increased his income through saving time and producing excellent qualities.

Hassane has six employees, thus he has to make sure that his business keeps on developing, to make sure that he can cover his employees expenses and needs.

He hopes to keep on developing his business through expanding his factory and increasing his machines.

loans.use: to buy the necessary threads and textiles for his factory.

loans.name: Sokan

texts.en:
Sokan is 52 years old and a married mother blessed with eight children. Her main sources of income are from her own business as a blacksmith and from the paid-working job, which she has been involved in for 20 years. 

This is the sixth cycle for Sokan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has repaid completely, has enabled her to improve her living conditions better than before. Now, she is in need of working capital in order to buy a decent motorbike to support her business as well as to serve as transportation to give her kids a lift to school. 

She hopes that she can own a proper motorbike for commuting so that she can save some transportation costs. This way she can pay more attention to the care of her children.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is a farmer from Deghdzut village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband, two daughters (19 and 17 years old), and son (15 years old). It has been more than 15 years since Anahit and her family started to be extensively engaged in agribusiness. With the help of her husband, she breeds a livestock of oxen, piglets, and hens and cultivates beans, peach, apricot, cherries, plum, strawberries, apple and pear. They realize the agricultural products at the local market, which is the main source of family’s income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Anahit needs to make some investments in it. She particularly needs a loan of USD 2,000 to purchase fertilizers, some forage for the livestock, and tree layers. The loan will help her greatly to maintain and develop her agribusiness. 

As this is Anahit’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who don't have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. The family will be very thankful to the lenders for their goodwill and support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, some forage for the livestock, and tree layers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a rope-making business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Maria is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her rope-making business.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Kuka

texts.en:
Kuka is a mixed farmer in Emali town, where she plants cash crops as well as keeps livestock. She is 54 years old, married to Henry, and they have been blessed with 10 children. She has been in the farming business for 13 years, and right now her monthly income is 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).


She plans to use this loan to buy farm inputs for use on her farm. These include fertilizer and seedlings for planting. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her farming business.


She hopes to be successful in her farming and live a good life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine operates a cereal shop business, selling household consumables like wheat, rice and maize. She cites theft and competition as her major challenge in the business. 

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to boost her cereal business. The loan will be used to purchase grains of wheat, maize and rice for sale in her business. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: purchase grains of wheat, maize and rice to sell in her cereal shop

loans.name: Ruddy Antonio

texts.es: El joven Ruddy a sus 30 años de edad tiene su negocio propio donde se dedica a venter todo tipo de Refrescos, Comidas y Golosinas, actualmente requiere de capital para la compra de Mesas con sus respectivas Sillas, un Toldo y Golosinas, su negocio esta ubicado en Ticuantepe gracias a su negocio a salido adelante hasta tien contratada a dos personas que le ayudan a realizar y vender almuerzos y el distribuye en la alcaldia, hospital y diferentes parte el municipio. el espera con obteber mayores ganancias para poder tener en un futuro un comedor donde pueda ofrecerle a sus clientes de todo lo que le solicitan.
texts.en: Young Ruddy, 30 years old, has his own business where he sells all kinds of soft-drinks, food and snacks. At present he is in need of capital to buy tables with matching chairs, an awning and snacks. His business is located in Ticuantepe. Thanks to his business he has been able to get ahead and has even hired two people who help him to make and sell lunches that he distributes at city hall, the hospital and different parts of the city. He hopes to earn a higher income to have a dining area in the future where he can offer his customers everything they request.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and kitchen materials.

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.en:
Gulruhsor is an industrious woman. She is married and has four children. She lives with her large family in a house that was built with the dedication of her father-in-law. Gulruhsor’s husband is a builder. 


For many years, she has not any job because she had been busy with bringing up her children. Now, she needs to make money. So, she is going to organize her own business with animal husbandry. She took part in the course, ‘To Get Ahead’, at a women’s organization. She got a certificate. 


Gulruhsor is asking for a loan to buy cattle for organizing a business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 42 years old and runs a retail shop in Kangundo town. She has been in the business for three years, and it has been profitable. She is married, and together with her spouse, has been blessed with two children.


She plans to use this loan to buy more goods to sell in her shop. These include cooking oil, rice, sugar and flour. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more goods. 


This is her second loan term; she paid her previous loan successfully. Her future hope is to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more goods, such as cooking oil, rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгул 40 лет, вдова, одна воспитывает 4 детей. У Назгул рано умер супруг, дети остались без отца и без главного кормильца семьи. Назгул очень тяжело пришлось пережить эту смерть и в конце-концов она взяла себя в руки и нашла работу, для того чтобы прокормить свою семью. Назгул работает в кондитерской, в качестве упаковщицы посменно, вахтовым методом. Но зарплаты, к сожалению не хватает на содержание семьи и в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Назгул решила заняться животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Назгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 нетели, 10 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 2,25 ГА, на которой выращивает пшеницу и экспарцет.  Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Назгул очень предприимчивая и старательная женщина, она верит, что у ее семьи все будет хорошо. Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства для улучшения финансового состояния и создания хорошего будущего для своих детей.
texts.en:
=Nazgul is 40 years old and she is a widow who is raising four children.  Her husband died young and her children were left without their father and the main family breadwinner.  It was very hard for Nazgul to survive his death, but she finally got a hold of herself and found some work so she could feed her family.  She works in a bakery as a part-time packer on a rotational basis, but unfortunately her salary is not enough to support her family and as a source of additional income she decided to raise animals.  She started doing this 15 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 3,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, she now has two cows, ten sheep and she also has a 2.25 hectare plot of land on which she grows wheat and legumes.  Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS).  

With the goal of developing her business further, Nazgul has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy bulls to fatten up and sell for a profit at the local market.  Nazgul is a very enterprising and industrious woman and she believes that she can do well for her family.  She plans to use the income from the loan to further increase her head of livestock and she also intends to raise money to improve her financial situation and to build a good future for her children.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 33-year-old single Syrian citizen. She has been working in a clothing shop for the last three years. Zeinbeh supports three members of her family and works hard to provide them with their basic needs.  

She is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to cover her urgent medical needs, as she is unable to do so with her low income.
Zeinab has a good reputation in her region and she works hard to keep it that way. One day, she hopes that she'll be capable of opening her own shop and improving her family's living situation.

loans.use: to pay for her urgent medical needs

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam has a retail shop business that she has been running in Emali town for three years. She is 35 years old and married. Together with her spouse she has been blessed with three children. Her spouse also provides additional income.

She plans to buy sugar, rice, flour, and cereals for selling in her shop. She will use the generated profits to pay school fees for her children. This is her first loan term and she hopes to grow her business, make more income, and be able to educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour, and cereals for selling.

loans.name: Lenah

texts.en:
Lenah sells fruits and vegetables in Kitengela town and has been in this business for four years. She is 42 years old and widowed with three children. 

Lenah will use this loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables for selling. These include oranges, mangoes, and bananas as well as tomatoes and cabbages. She will use the anticipated profits to open a grocery store. This is Lenah's first loan and her future hope is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, 37 years old, is married and lives in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. She has two children, of which one is an infant and the other is school-aged.

From her desire to help the family, she engaged in a snack vending business selling rice cakes, pancakes, and others. Starting up with a capitalization of 3,000 PHP, she was able to manage the business, earn an extra income, and sustain the other needs of her family. It has operated for ten years already.              

In 2011, Alma applied for her membership in PMPC. Upon hearing all of the benefits of being a member, she never hesitated to become one. Now, she is planning to borrow 20,000 PHP from PMPC to buy additional raw ingredients for her snack vending business. Through this project, she believes to raise more income and be of help for the expansion of their business. Alma has found comfort in their financial needs through PMPC, of which she is very thankful with all her heart. She wants to have a stall in the public market to display a variety of food (snacks). Someday she will be happy seeing her children finish their studies and live comfortably with adequate income out from her little business.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is from Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. She is 58 years old and is married. 

In 2013, Vicky applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Vicky is asking a financial assistance of 10,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store (general store). Through this, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for their financial needs through PMPC and she is very thankful with all of her heart. She hopes to maintain the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

loans.use: to restock inventories for her sari-sari store (general store).

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 53 years old. She is married and lives in Bangkal, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. Nancy is engaged in a food vending business at her house. She has been in this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients for her snacks vending. 

In 2008, Nancy applied for her membership in PMPC, and she enjoys the benefits being a member of the cooperative. In the future, she hopes to save enough money for house repair. She wants to live a happy and comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian works hard to support her family. Marian is married and has a buying and selling of used clothing business in the Philippines.

Marian requested a 5,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of used clothing to sell to her customers.

Marian has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Marian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of used clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel has a live-in partner and two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maribel is 25 years old.

Maribel has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients (such as flour, sugar, salt, and coconut) for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients (such as flour, sugar, salt, and coconut) for her business.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Dorah operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over two years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business and she dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Johnamay

texts.en:
Johnamay is 52 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Johnamay has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from raising chickens.

Johnamay is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feeds for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: José Mario

texts.es:
José de 64 años de edad, es un sastre reconocido en la ciudad, por su empeño y orden en su trabajo, desde muy pequeño aprendió a coser en un taller siendo ayudante.  Él se vio obligado  a trabajar desde muy pequeño, porque viene de una familia de escasos recursos económicos; a su esposa la conoció hace más de treinta años y junto  a ella procrearon  5 hijos, de los cuales solo una hija que es madre soltera vive con ellos.  

Su experiencia es más o menos de 45 años, ya que toda su vida ha trabajado como  sastre, a su lado  trabaja su esposa en ocasiones ayudando cuando  hay saturación de trabajo, pues él tiene un contrato con 10 escuelas para entregar uniforme a los estudiantes.   

El préstamo será utilizado, para la compra de materia prima en la elaboración de uniformes como  lo son: Botones, sipers, hilo, agujas y el mantenimiento de las máquinas de coser que posee, además, de la compra de una maquina adicional,  pues ya no  da abasto con las que tiene.  

En el futuro planea mantener su sastrería en buenas condiciones, ya que le está generando fuentes de empleo y es una fuente para salir adelante con su esposa.
texts.en:
José is 64 years old and is a tailor well-known in his town for dedication and the neatness of his work. He learned to sew from a young age as a helper in a workshop. He was obliged to work from a very young age because he comes from a low-income family. He met his wife more than 30 years ago, and together they have five children, of whom only one daughter, who is a single mother, lives with them.

His experience is more or less 45 years, and he has been working his whole life as a tailor. His wife works at his side, sometimes helping when there is an overabundance of work, as he has a contract with 10 schools to provide uniforms for the students.

The loan will be used to buy materials for making uniforms, such as buttons, zippers, threads, needles; for maintaining his sewing machines and for buying an additional machine, as the ones he has are not sufficient.

In the future he intends to maintain his tailoring shop in good condition, as it is generating a source of employment for him, and is a way for he and his wife to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy raw material for making uniforms, such as buttons, zippers, threads, needles; for maintaining his sewing machines and for buying an additional machine, as the ones he has are not sufficient.

loans.name: Dubai Group

texts.en:
Ombeni, who is in his is 30s, is single.  He has been running two businesses (a hotel and a blacksmith shop) for five years now.  He works from 6 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Ombeni's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to open a hotel and bought more pipes for making more grills.  He has paid back all his loans successfully and is very grateful for the loans and appreciates all who have contributed on his Dubai group.  He used the profit to cover household expenses and bought some items which were missing in his hotel.  He will use this loan to buy more blacksmith equipment and manage to finish the pending orders.  He dreams of expanding his blacksmith business.

Ombeni will share this loans with his loan group, DUBAI, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more blacksmith equipment and manage to finish the pending orders.

loans.name: Damaris Azucena

texts.es: la señora Damaris, madre soltera dedicada por completo a sus dos hijos quienes estan en edades escolares, ella trabaja para una casa privada desde hace mas de 3 años, su mayor meta es terminar de construir su casa ya que le ha costado mucho, el credito lo solicita para comprar, bloques, cemento y arena ya que terminara de completar un pared de un cuarto para obtener mayor seguridad. agradece el apoyo que se le ha brindado y la confianza que Kiva y Afodenic han puesto en ella.
texts.en:
Damaris is a single mother who is completely devoted to her two school-aged children. She has been working as a domestic in a private home for more than three years.

Her greatest goal is to finish building her house, as it has been very difficult for her. She is requesting a loan to buy cement blocks, cement and sand, as she will finish completing a wall of one room in order to obtain greater security. 

She is grateful for the support that has been offered her, and the trust that Kiva and Afodenic have placed in her.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Kosim

texts.en:
Kosim is purposeful man. He is married and has 2 children. His wife is a housewife. Three years ago Kosim began his own business, selling industrial goods such buckets, teapots, etc. He sells his goods in a local market and manages his business alone. Year by year with passing time, Kosim has perfected his knowledge and abilities in business.

He wants to increase his working capital and in this way to attract more customers. Kosim is asking for a loan to buy goods to sell in order to increase his working capital. From the profits he is going to improve his living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell in order to increase his working capital.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
This is Rosana, 45, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jesus, her business partner, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Rosana operates a propeller shop. Her husband is the one making the propellers while she is in charge of the managing and finances of the business. Her shop is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are businesses in the local community. She earns a minimum of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy propeller materials and other products needed in propeller making.

Rosana dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for propeller materials and other products needed in propeller making.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is from Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. She is 48 years old and married. 

In 2009, Anita applied for her membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Anita asked for financial assistance in the amount of Php 10,000 to purchase materials to repair her house. She has found assistance for the family's financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart. She hopes to maintain the status of being a member in good standing and repay her obligations in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair her house (wood, nails, hollow blocks & sand).

loans.name: James

texts.en: James sells spare car parts and has been in this business for close to two years now.  He is 46 years old, married, and together with his spouse has been blessed with three children.  He makes a monthly income of KES 13,450.  Besides selling spare parts, he also sells phone accessories such as phone covers, batteries and chargers.  He plans to use the loan to buy more stock of spare car parts to sell. This will enable him to meet his customers' demands and thereby make more income.  He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and expand his business.  This is his first loan term and he hopes to grow his business, make more income, and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock spare car parts to sell.

loans.name: Luis Arturo

texts.es:
Luis, está acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 16 años de edad, no posee ayuda del extranjero, se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol, es un oficio que aprendió de su familia, trabaja de 6:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m., tiene una experiencia de 40 que le respalda la realización de esta actividad.
Comprará insumos agrícolas como insecticidas, plaguicidas, abono, con lo que espera tener una cosecha abundante, un aumento en sus ventas y una mejora en su economía.
Sueña con tener un negocio más amplio con mucha rentabilidad que le dé la posibilidad de mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia y una educación superior a su hijo.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his life partner and their 16-year-old son. He has no help from outside the country, and grows corn and beans, an occupation he learned from his family. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m., and has 40 years experience to back him up in doing this work.

He will buy agricultural supplies such as insecticides, pesticides and fertilizer, with which he hopes to have an abundant harvest, an increase in his sales, and an improvement in his financial situation. 

He dreams of having a larger business with great profitability that will give him the chance to improve his family's living conditions and provide his son with higher education.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 50 years old and is married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items (such as diapers, canned goods, sanitary napkins, biscuits, noodles, and eggs) to sell in her general store.

Marissa has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns additional income from retailing purified drinking water. Marissa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items (such as diapers, canned goods, sanitary napkins, biscuits, noodles, and eggs) to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg is a young farmer from Byuravan village of the Ararat region. He lives with his wife, parents, and his brother. The latter is currently in the military service in the army. To take care of his family, Gevorg is engaged in the cultivation of tomatoes, peaches, apricots, cherries, plums, grapes, apples, and pears. He realizes the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of family’s income. Gevorg’s family members assist him greatly in his everyday activities related to farming. 

To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Gevorg needs to make some investments. He particularly needs a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase fertilizers, buy tree layers, and pay for the harvesting services and the workforce. As this is Gevorg’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Gevorg and his family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for the support.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, buy tree layers, and pay for harvesting services and the workforce.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Juliet earns more income from fishing.

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients (such as flour, cream, sugar, and eggs) for her bakery business. Juliet has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients (such as flour, cream, sugar, and eggs) for her bakery business.

loans.name: Marrieta

texts.en:
Marrieta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell frozen foods and fruits business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years and earns more income from raising pigs and operating a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods and fruits to sell through her business. Marrieta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.  She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. for her general store business.  Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Kenia Isabel

texts.es: Kenia es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega, madre de dos hijos. Es de oficio carpintera, se dedica a la carpintería. Ella es una mujer emprendedora, que desde muy joven se ha dedicado a esta actividad. Desde hace ocho años inicio su propio negocio, de  la cual es propietaria. Solicita el crédito para comprar: madera en grandes cantidades y herramientas como: serruchos, clavos, entre otros materiales, con el fin de abastecer a todos sus clientes. Estima que este crédito le será beneficioso ya que podrá cumplir con la demanda de su clientela y podrá aumentar las ventas de sus muebles. Su plan futuro es tener maquinas actualizadas para la elaboración de muebles, y así llegar muy lejos este negocio.
texts.en: Kenia is a mother of two from the city of Chinandega. She is a carpenter. She is an enterprising woman and has dedicated herself to this activity since she was young. Eight years ago she started her own business, of which she is the owner. She is requesting this loan to buy: large quantities of wood and tools, such as saws and nails, among other things in order to stock up for her clients. She estimates that this loan will be beneficial as she'll be able to fulfill client demand and increase  furniture sales. Her future plans include having the machines necessary to make furniture and thus take her business further.

loans.use: To buy: large quantities of wood and tools, like saws and nails, among other materials.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is a 34-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of seven children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For a long time, he has wanted to replace his old rickshaw's body. He is unable to attract passengers due to the ugly looking vehicle and to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of the new rickshaw body. Therefore, Farzana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of the rickshaw body. This will help him to continue his business. Farzana is so very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw body.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is 35 years old and lives with her five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband has been running a mobile phone shop for twelve years and earning sufficient income. Her husband troubleshoots mobile phones, sells mobile phone accessories such as chargers, batteries, covers, data cables, etc.,  and provides recharge facilities of different networks.  Nowadays the demand for mobile accessories and for recharging has increased a lot; sometimes he has to turn away customers.  But he does not have the savings to further invest into the business because he already has spent his savings on household expenses.  Therefore, Shahida has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy additional accessories and extra credit for the recharging facility. Shahida thanks Kiva and its field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is an experienced agronomist from Ginevet village in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, daughter and son. The latter is a contractual serviceman in the military service. For more than 10 years, Susanna and her family members have been engaged in the cultivation of wheat, peaches, apricots, and apples. They sell their agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. 

As winter is very close, Susanna needs to make some investments in her agribusiness in order for it to be ready for the cold season. A loan of USD2700 will help this hard-working woman and her family a lot, enabling her to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers, and to pay for harvesting services. Susanna and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the amount needed for the loan to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers, and to pay for harvesting services

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en: Ismael is a 17-year-old single young man from Gaza City.  He lives with his family in a small house in the city.  Ismael's father works as an employee in the public sector with a low income.  This is the only income to the family.  Ismael is a university student in his first year.  He studies engineering and he would like to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family with part of the family expenses.  Ismael has requested a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies.  By taking this loan, Ismael will be able to do his homework and reports by using special engineering programs.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Jackie Lou

texts.en: Jackie Lou is married with one child. She is 32 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban, Philippines. Jackie Lou is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan to purchase feeds and other agrivet supplies. Jackie Lou has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Jackie Lou hopes to save for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other agrivet supplies

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa, 46, is married and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. She generates money through her sari-sari store business. Her business is the only one she has had. It means that their source of living is her sari-sari store. Fortunately, because of the high demand of the customers, she needs additional stock for her business. She is borrowing money from PMPC. In addition to that, she became a member for 1 year.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her sari-sari (variety store) business.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is a happy married woman with a child. She is 25 years old from Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.  She has a business of rice retailing. She generates income through it.  Indeed, it is a great help for her to sustain her family's needs.  Because the needs and wants of her family increase, she needs additional income to sustain them.  She asks help from PMPC to cater to her needs.  She has requested a loan to buy additional stocks for her rice retailing business.  Indeed PMPC helps her to achieve things she wants.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her rice retailing business

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is 31 years old, married, and together with her spouse has been blessed with two children.  She has a maize mill business in Kangundo town. She also sells maize flour to her customers.  She has been in this business for 2 years and it has been profitable.  She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of maize from which she will produce maize flour to sell.  She will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of her family.  Having paid back her previous loan successfully, this will be her second loan term.  She hopes to have a big business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry maize to grind

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has had a grocery store in Kitengela town for the past five years. It has been profitable as she earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. She is 23 years old, single and has one child.

Elizabeth plans to buy fruit and vegetable to sell in her business. These include oranges, bananas, mangoes, spinach and cabbages. She will use the anticipated income to open another grocery business.

In the future, she hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy does farming in Emali town. He is 63 years old, married to Catherine, and they have been blessed with 2 children. He has been in the farming business for 15 years now and his monthly income is about 24,500 Kes.

He plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer, manure and seedlings for planting on his farm. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

This is his 8th loan term and he paid all his previous loans successfully. In the future, Sammy hopes be successful in his farming business and live a stable life together with his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, manure and seedlings.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 34 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, spices, etc.

She has borrowed and paid back 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fishing. Aida aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like soap, shampoo, eggs, canned goods, spices, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary appreciates the previous loan that helped her to pay school fees for her children and to buy food products for her business. Here again she comes to you asking for a loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy maize flour, wheat flour, rice and beans for her business. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, wheat flour, rice and beans for her business

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Melanie is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, noodles, etc. for her food vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. Melanie hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, noodles, etc. for her food vending business.

loans.name: Hanzel

texts.en: Hanzel is 39 years old and married with seven children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Hanzel is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Hanzel has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Richel

texts.en: Richel is 33 years old and married with seven children.  She works hard to provide for her family.
